thread.title: Former DNC Official Meets With Known Bomber to Dig Up Dirt on Trump
thread.title_full: Former DNC Official Meets With Known Bomber to Dig Up Dirt on Trump

author: Wilmot Proviso
title: Former DNC Official Meets With Known Bomber to Dig Up Dirt on Trump
text:
Hungary Plans to Stop Flood of Migrants With Military Bases on Its Border 
According to The Daily Caller , Chalupa — an anti-Trump activist with ties to the government of Ukraine — met with so-called “Speedway Bomber” Brett Kimberlin and South African-born Israeli national Yoni Ariel. 
Kimberlin was convicted of a series of bombings in Speedway, Indiana, in 1978. Police suspected Kimberlin had used the bombings to distract from the murder of a woman who was the mother of an employee at a business he used to launder money from his drug-dealing activities. Kimberlin was a suspect in that murder, according to Breitbart . 
Later, according to Time , Kimberlin engaged in a campaign where he offered to pay anyone who had evidence that President George W. Bush rigged the 2004 election. If you’re beginning to notice a pattern here, you’re not alone.   
Kimberlin was part of a plot involving the purchase of documents which, according to BuzzFeed, concluded that Rex Tillerson had made a “$1.6 billion wire transfer from petroleum giant ExxonMobil to a European office of a Chinese mining company, which a day later transferred 1.4 billion euros to the Trump Organization, the privately held conglomerate founded by President Trump.” 
The documents were supposed to show that Tillerson had paid for the secretary of state job. Wonder of wonders, the documents were an elaborate (well, not that elaborate) hoax. 
According to The Daily Caller , when Chalupa, Kimberlin, and Ariel met in Washington, Ariel informed them of the existence of the “documents,” and Kimberlin later agreed to pay the $9,000 asking price and Alex’s three plane tickets to Rome in order to procure them. 
Needless to say, the whole thing didn’t quite turn out the way they had planned.
